Julius, Nicole's father, shares a heartfelt moment with her, reminiscing about her childhood. Zende is nervous but reassured by his family and friends, including Sasha, who expresses her happiness for the couple. Eric and Quinn host the wedding at their estate, with Quinn feeling slightly possessive about her place in the house. The ceremony is officiated by Carter, and everyone is gathered to celebrate the union on Valentine's Day. The atmosphere is filled with love and anticipation as Nicole prepares to walk down the aisle.</summary>

<summary>Wyatt is contemplating returning to work at Spencer Publications after his father, Bill, asked him to come back. Sally, Wyatt's partner, is concerned about her past issues with Bill, who previously destroyed her business, Spectra Fashions. Wyatt assures Sally that he won't return to Spencer unless Bill agrees to resurrect Spectra Fashions as part of the deal. Meanwhile, Katie is dealing with the aftermath of her annulment from Thorne, who left because he believed Katie still had feelings for Bill. Bill, focusing on family, expresses his support for Katie and their son, Will, without criticizing Thorne. Justin, Bill's friend, discusses Bill's happiness and his relationship with Katie with Donna, Katie's sister. Wyatt expresses his desire to reclaim his position at Spencer and believes Sally can achieve great success independently. Sally appreciates Wyatt's support and love, acknowledging that he changed her life and gave her confidence. They both express their commitment to each other and their future together.</summary>

<summary>Hope and Liam are dealing with the complications of their relationship due to Steffy's refusal to sign annulment papers, forcing them to wait six months for a divorce. Meanwhile, Brooke and Ridge are preparing for a dinner with Katie and Bill, who are trying to encourage their husbands to get along despite their differences. Throughout the evening, tensions and unresolved feelings are evident among the characters, highlighting the complexities of their intertwined relationships.</summary>

<summary>Nick is concerned about Taylor's ability to care for their son, Jack, due to her recent drinking relapse and emotional instability. Brooke supports Nick's decision to seek an emergency custody hearing to ensure Jack's safety, despite Taylor's desire to be with her child. Taylor, feeling betrayed by Nick's actions, is determined to prove she can care for Jack and enlists Rick's help to remove alcohol from her home. Rick, who has grown close to Taylor, reassures her of his support and questions if her place in life is with Jack. Meanwhile, Felicia and Ridge discuss their parents' anniversary and Ridge's relationship with Brooke, which is strained due to the custody situation. Storm, acting as Nick's attorney, prepares for the custody hearing, emphasizing the need to prove Taylor's instability. Taylor receives the court summons and is devastated, believing Brooke is behind the custody battle. Nick reassures Brooke that they are doing the right thing for Jack's well-being. Taylor, emotional and upset, calls Nick to express her disbelief and accuses Brooke of wanting to take her child. Rick comforts Taylor, promising to support her through the custody challenge.</summary>

<summary>
Liam and Steffy discuss the challenges of co-parenting and the emotional toll of being apart from their children, Kelly and Beth. Meanwhile, Thomas is rushing into a marriage with Zoe, causing distress for his son, Douglas, who is not ready for the change. Hope is concerned about Douglas's well-being and feels Thomas is manipulating the situation to push her away from Douglas. Thomas's true intentions are questioned by Steffy, who suspects he is using the wedding to provoke Hope into marrying him instead. Liam warns Hope that Thomas's actions are part of a plan to manipulate her emotions, similar to past behavior. Zoe is excited about the marriage but is aware of Douglas's discomfort. Carter reassures Zoe that Douglas just needs time to adjust. Steffy confronts Thomas about his motives, suspecting he is using the wedding as a ploy to win Hope back.
</summary>

<summary>Ridge and Rick are in a tense discussion about a corner store and past grievances, with Ridge using business tactics to lower the price. Rick accuses Ridge of manipulating him out of their family home, which Ridge dismisses. Meanwhile, Caroline is at home, preparing for a girl's day, but ends up going into labor with Thomas by her side. Thomas expresses his desire to be a good big brother and role model for the new baby. Ridge receives a call from Caroline about her labor and rushes home, leaving Rick to handle business matters. Eric, their father, arrives and learns about the labor, leading to a discussion with Rick about family dynamics and Ridge's controlling nature. Rick feels ousted from his job and home, blaming Ridge's manipulative behavior. Despite the tension, Eric emphasizes the importance of family and the joy of a new Forrester baby. As Caroline's labor progresses, Ridge and Caroline share a tender moment, reaffirming their love and commitment. The scene ends with anticipation for the birth of their child, symbolizing a new chapter for the family.</summary>

<summary>
Steffy and Liam are preparing for their wedding in Sydney, with various family members and friends joining them on the trip. Quinn and Eric are excited about attending the wedding as a couple, while Brooke and Ridge are also looking forward to their own upcoming nuptials. Sally is contemplating attending the wedding as Thomas's date, despite the complications it might bring. Meanwhile, Shirley encourages Sally to go for the publicity and potential business benefits. On the plane, the group is in high spirits, with Steffy and Liam expressing gratitude for everyone's support. Tensions and past issues linger among some characters, but the focus remains on the joyous occasion ahead.
</summary>

<summary>Brooke, Bill, and Donna are dealing with the aftermath of a car accident involving Brooke and Bill, which has led to Katie being hospitalized with heart failure. Katie had an episode after discovering Bill spent the night at Brooke's house, leading to a confrontation and her subsequent heart issues. Donna questions Brooke and Bill about their involvement in Katie's condition, suspecting their actions may have contributed to her stress. Brooke and Bill insist nothing inappropriate happened, but they are hiding the details of the accident to avoid scandal. Taylor, who was supposed to have a session with Katie, is suspicious of Brooke and Bill's behavior and believes their actions have negatively impacted Katie. Dr. Meade informs the family that Katie's condition is due to myocarditis, possibly from missing her medication. Despite the tension and secrets, the family is united in their hope for Katie's recovery.</summary>

<summary>Steffy and Liam discuss their excitement about becoming parents, with Liam expressing his commitment to Steffy and their future child. Eric offers emotional support to Brooke, who is visibly upset and contemplating seeking professional help. Hope, dealing with her own emotional struggles, encounters Steffy and expresses her intention to move forward positively despite past grievances. Meanwhile, Bill shares fatherly advice with Liam, emphasizing the importance of cherishing his relationship with Steffy. The narrative concludes with Steffy attempting to return home to Liam amidst traffic delays, while Hope reflects on her feelings and future. </summary>

<summary>Beth is struggling with memory loss and fears it may be early dementia, leading her to consider leaving her family to avoid being a burden. Her daughters, Brooke, Katie, and Donna, along with their father Stephen, urge her to stay, emphasizing their love and willingness to support her through this difficult time. Ultimately, Beth decides to remain with her family, acknowledging her fear but choosing to cherish the time they have together.</summary>

<summary>Brooke and Nick are stuck on a boat in the fog, unable to reach Catalina for dinner, and they discuss their situation and share a meal of freshly caught fish. Meanwhile, Rick confronts Sally about her daughter Macy's relationship with Deacon, expressing concern that Macy is making a mistake by getting involved with him. Sally defends Macy's choices, insisting that Macy and Deacon are moving on with their lives and that Macy has a positive influence on Deacon's children. Deacon proposes to Macy, assuring her that his intentions are genuine and not a way to circumvent Brooke's restraining order. Macy is hesitant due to her past mistakes but acknowledges her feelings for Deacon. Rick and Sally continue to argue about the implications of Macy's involvement with Deacon, with Sally supporting Macy's independence. Nick and Brooke discuss their lives and aspirations, with Nick expressing a desire for a family and Brooke reflecting on their similarities. They both acknowledge that while they may be lost in the fog, they are not truly lost in life.</summary>

<summary>Brooke decides to step down as the spokeswoman for her successful clothing line, Brooke's Bedroom, and offers the position to her sister, Donna, as she seeks new challenges in her life. Despite Donna's initial hesitation and concerns about modeling, Brooke reassures her and expresses confidence in her abilities. Meanwhile, Bridget and Dante face tension in their relationship as Bridget reveals she is relieved not to be pregnant, leading to a disagreement about their future together. Felicia, who shares a child with Dante, expresses her feelings for him and suggests that he might be happier with her. Ridge, who has been inspired by Brooke in his designs, initially decides not to continue designing for the bedroom line but is eventually persuaded by Donna to stay involved. Throughout the narrative, the complex relationships and emotional struggles of the characters are highlighted, with themes of love, destiny, and personal growth interwoven.</summary>

<summary>Felicia confronts Nick for telling her mother she has a drug habit, while Stephanie informs Eric about Nick's concerns regarding Felicia's potential drug problem. Meanwhile, Ridge and Thorne are embroiled in a conflict over their positions at Forrester, with Ridge believing Thorne is not a team player and expecting him to be removed from the company. Darla supports Thorne, believing he deserves to stay, and expresses confidence in his abilities. Eric and Stephanie struggle with the decision of who should leave the company, acknowledging their past favoritism towards Ridge. Tensions rise as Ridge and Thorne argue, with Ridge dismissing Darla's influence and urging Eric to make a decision. Ultimately, Eric decides that Ridge, not Thorne, will be the one to leave the company.</summary>

<summary>Donna's wedding to Thorne is abruptly halted when Thorne realizes, with the help of Katie, that Donna's intentions are not genuine and are driven by a desire for revenge against Stephanie. Despite Donna's insistence that she loves Thorne, he decides not to go through with the marriage, leaving Donna devastated and vowing revenge against Stephanie. Meanwhile, Stephanie feels vindicated, believing that Thorne has finally seen Donna's true nature.</summary>

<summary>Donna is distraught after being kicked out of her home by Eric's family, who believe she was unfaithful when Eric saw her being comforted by Owen. Eric, who recently emerged from a coma, is being protected by his family, particularly Stephanie, who is determined to keep Donna away. Despite Donna's insistence that she was not unfaithful, Stephanie and the family are adamant about keeping her away from Eric to ensure his recovery. Meanwhile, Taylor struggles with feelings of inadequacy as a mother, fearing she might lose custody of her baby again. Brooke tries to mediate but is also kept at a distance due to her connection to Donna. Donna remains resolute in her determination to explain the situation to Eric and win him back, despite Stephanie's manipulations.</summary>

<summary>Hope is dealing with the aftermath of her broken relationship with Liam, who has been influenced by misunderstandings and external pressures, including his father Bill's disapproval and Steffy's involvement. Deacon, Hope's father, returns to support her, expressing regret for his past absence and the unintended consequences of his actions. Meanwhile, Bill is pushing Liam to embrace his Spencer legacy, dismissing Hope's feelings and encouraging Liam to move on. At Forrester Creations, tensions rise as Rick aims to capitalize on publicity for Hope's fashion line, while Caroline and Thomas navigate their own complicated relationships. Despite the turmoil, Hope remains hopeful for a fresh start, valuing her father's presence and support.</summary>

<summary>
Thorne is surprised by the support and recognition he receives from his parents, Eric and Stephanie, who express their love and pride in him despite past misunderstandings. Eric offers Thorne a collection as a gift and invites him to return to Forrester, acknowledging Thorne's contributions that were previously overlooked. Meanwhile, Ridge expresses concern over his son Thomas's involvement with Amber, who has a restraining order against her, and warns Thomas to stay away from her. Despite Ridge's warnings, Thomas continues to see Amber secretly, and they enjoy their time together without Ridge's oversight. Caitlin informs Stephanie about Amber's job at Insomnia, suspecting it's a way for Amber to see Thomas, and Stephanie promises to handle the situation. Thorne reflects on his parents' forgiveness and respect but remains skeptical about returning to Forrester without a significant role change. Ridge reassures Brooke of his love before leaving on a business trip, promising that nothing can separate them. Stephanie confronts Amber at her workplace, accusing her of lying about her intentions with Thomas. The tension between family loyalty and personal desires is evident throughout the interactions.
</summary>

<summary>Bill advises Liam to call off his engagement to Hope, believing she doesn't prioritize him. Meanwhile, Hope is unaware of the tension and assumes Liam is enjoying a sophisticated bachelor party. Steffy, who has feelings for Liam, argues with Katie about Hope's treatment of him and is encouraged by Bill to intervene. Despite being upset with Hope for not moving up their wedding date, Liam remains committed to working things out with her. Bill orchestrates a plan to have Steffy drive Liam home, hoping to end his engagement with Hope. Liam, however, intends to discuss his feelings with Hope and resolve their issues. Steffy offers support and suggests spending the night with Liam, but he declines, remaining focused on his relationship with Hope.</summary>

<summary>Nick and Bridget are grappling with the potential fallout of Bridget's pregnancy, which could jeopardize Nick's marriage to Brooke, who does not want more children.
